posts.name: Black Hog BBQ Bar
posts.note: Black Hog BBQ Bar is a local chain offering Carolina and Arkansas-style 'cue, with ribs, wings, sides, and drinks. You need to order the Carolina Chopped smoked pork shoulder with vinegar sauce or the Arkansas Brisket which double smoked, rough cut, smoked again with some sweet and smoky sauce. NOTE: They have multiple locations.

posts.name: Brewer's Alley
posts.note: Brewer's Alley is a kid friendly and invites you to visit and enjoy the house beers at their distinctive bar as well as some of the Finest Culinary Creations in one of their beautiful dining rooms. In the heart of Historic Frederick, Maryland, Brewer's Alley has become a favorite destination for residents and worldwide travelers alike.

posts.name: Bruster's
posts.note: Bruster's has counter-serve chain where all of the ice cream selections are made fresh on-site every day. If you like salted caramel ice cream, you need to order their sea salt caramel ice cream. If you like dark chocolate from what I could see you need to get Bruster's death by chocolate. NOTE: They have multiple locations.

posts.name: Bushwaller's
posts.note: Bushwaller’s prides themselves on serving fresh, house-made cuisine in the warmth and comfort of an Irish Pub. For over 30 years, Bushwaller’s has been one of downtown Frederick’s most popular restaurants. They specialize in serving savory Irish and American comfort dishes such as Fish ‘n Chips, Shepherd’s Pie, Bangers ‘n Mash, Guinness Beef Stew, and Burgers. Bushwaller’s likes to think of themselves as the community living room, so they strive to create a casual, inviting, flavorful dining experience at affordable prices Great, quite a local bar to relax, talk, eat, and drink or at least the day we were there.

posts.name: Chick and Ruth's
posts.note: Chick and Ruth's is a lively landmark diner is featuring greasy-spoon breakfasts and piled-high sandwiches in kitschy environs. You need to try their breakfast items or one of their other meals named after famous people.

posts.name: Crab Deck
posts.note: The Crab Deck is a full service, waterfront dining, inside and outside on the Kent Narrows with lunch, dinner, happy hour, kids menu, and steamed crabs. When I'm here, I get an order of steamed shrimp, three or four of their largest crabs, and a side of corn on the cob, so I at least ate one vegetable.

posts.name: Davis's Pub
posts.note: Davis's Pub is a long-running (since the 1920s) neighborhood joint known for its crab cakes and creative pub fare.

posts.name: Double T Diner
posts.note: Double T Diner is a Local diner chain with a retro vibe and a menu of comfort-food classics (some are open 24 hours). You need to try some of their great desserts along with the substantial breakfasts. NOTE: They have multiple locations.

posts.name: Family Meal Restaurant
posts.note: Family Meal Restaurant is a modern, all-day diner from 'Top Chef' runner-up Bryan Voltaggio, set in a former car dealership. You could eat only appetizers and still walk away happy. I have ordered their hoecakes with pimento cheese, and pickled carrots, their Korean BBQ wings, duck fat fried potatoes, and their deviled eggs with applewood smoked bacon and chives.

posts.name: Gravel and Grind
posts.note: Gravel and Grind is a full-service bike shop with an artisan coffee shop in downtown Frederick, MD. You should order their hot chocolate or one of their herbal teas either cold or hot depending on the weather.

posts.name: Storm Brothers Ice Cream Factory
posts.note: Storm Brothers Ice Cream Factory is a neighborhood ice cream parlor serving cones, shakes, flurries, sundaes and more since 1976. They have over 40 flavors so you should be able to find something you want to eat.

posts.name: Thai Tanium Restaurant
posts.note: Thai Tanium Restaurant serves Thai specialties, has a full bar and lunch deals in a glossy space at Kentlands Market Square. You need to order the Larb Gai (minced chicken with a spicy lime sauce) along with the Pad Mee chicken (Drunken noodles) and the Thai Tanium Star which is shrimp with minced chicken, watercress, veggies, and a Thai shrimp cake.

posts.name: Tastee Diner
posts.note: Tastee Diner is a longtime old-school diner serving home-style American comfort-food classics 24 hours, 7 days a week. I have mostly been here for dessert and maybe a breakfast or two over the years. NOTE: They have multiple locations.

posts.name: Zoe's Chocolate Co.
posts.note: Zoe’s Chocolate combines the tradition of past generations and true artisan chocolatiers, with the modern sophistication of today’s flavors, trends, and ingredients. You need to buy yourself a roasted almond and dark chocolate bar.
